column1: Pilinehtar is the Elvish name of a plant.
column2: no. 45 (the drawing first appeared in the J.R.R. Tolkien Calendar 1979)The name only appears on a drawing of the plant; Christopher Tolkien describes the physical appearance of the plant as a "slender rushlike or grasslike plant".

column1: It has been suggested that pilinehtar consists of Quenya pilin "arrow" + ehtar "spearman"
column2: features that describe "the shape of the plants stems".
